Rule.name: Default Arguments Template
Rule.Description: The default arguments included with all calls to sailpoint.server.InternalContext.runRule()

Argument.name: context
Argument.Description: A sailpoint.api.SailPointContext object that can be used to query the database if necessary.

Argument.name: log
Argument.Description: The log object associated with the SailPointContext.

Rule.name: Account Selector Template
Rule.Description:
AccountSelector Rules are used by the role modeler to automatically select a target account for provisioning when there are multiple candidates.
The return value is a Link instance that represents the selection. Value can be:
null - indicates that no automatic selection can be made
"prompt" - indicates that a separate account selector should be presented for the role
existing Link - the selected Link from the list of possible target Links
a new Link instance - indicates that a new account must be created with the identity specified by the create policy, or manually; in this case, the Link instance returned will have a null nativeIdentity attribute

Argument.name: source
Argument.Description: The application doing the provisioning.

Argument.name: role
Argument.Description: The IT role being provisioned.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The target identity.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The target application.

Argument.name: links
Argument.Description: A list of the possible target Links.

Argument.name: isSecondary
Argument.Description: True if this is not the first assignment.

Argument.name: project
Argument.Description: The provisioning project.

Argument.name: accountRequest
Argument.Description: The account request.

Argument.name: allowCreate
Argument.Description: True if account creation is allowed.

Argument.name: selection
Argument.Description: A Link instance that represents the selection. Value can be: null - indicates that no automatic selection can be made Link - the selected Link from the list of possible target Links a new Link instance - indicates that a new account must be created with the identity specified by the create policy, or manually; in this case, the Link instance returned will have a null nativeIdentity attribute

Rule.name: Activity Condition Builder Template
Rule.Description: This rule is used by the jdbc activity collector and allows a rule to build the "where" clause that will be used when searching for new activities. This rule uses the map built by the ActivityPositionBuilder to construct the "where" clause.

Argument.name: config
Argument.Description: A Map containing the configuration info build by an ActivityPositionBuilderRule.

Argument.name: condition
Argument.Description: The condition String, or the object whose toString() results will be used.

Rule.name: Activity Correlation Template
Rule.Description: ActivityCorrelation Rules are used by the Activity Correlator to find Identity that performed the activities. Most data sources will return a name, which may or may not be what we store as the Link's identity. May also return a Link instead of a Map.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application where the activity was generated. An application may have more then one data source.

Argument.name: datasource
Argument.Description: The data source that returned the activity.

Argument.name: activity
Argument.Description: The activity object that was normalized by the data source and that we are trying to correlate back to one of our Identities.

Argument.name: linkInstance
Argument.Description: The name of the link instance on the application.

Argument.name: linkIdentity
Argument.Description: A string that represents the link's identity attribute.

Argument.name: linkName
Argument.Description: A string that represents the link's displayName attribute.

Argument.name: linkAttributeName
Argument.Description: A string that represents the NAME of an attribute that can be used to find the Link that maps back to this activity. This attribute must also be supplied with the linkAttributeValue variable.

Argument.name: linkAttributeValue
Argument.Description: A string that represents the VALUE of an attribute that can be used to find the Link that maps back to this activity. This attribute must also be supplied with the linkAttributeName variable.

Argument.name: identityName
Argument.Description: The name of an Identity object.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: A fully resolved Identity object in case the rule wants to do its own queries to locate the identity.

Argument.name: identityAttributeName
Argument.Description: The name of the extended attribute that can be used to locate an existing identity.

Argument.name: identityAttributeValue
Argument.Description: The value of the named extended attribute that can be used to locate an existing identity. This attribute is used together with the identityAttributeName argument.

Rule.name: Activity Position Builder Template
Rule.Description: This rule is used by the jdbc activity collector, taking the last record processed and building a map that is stored on the application so that we can construct a "where we left off" condition in the activity condition builder.

Argument.name: row
Argument.Description: A ResultSet of the row .

Argument.name: map
Argument.Description: A Map of the row's information that can be used by an ActivityConditionBuilder rule.

Rule.name: Activity Transformation Template
Rule.Description: ActivityTransformation Rules are used by the LogFileCollector to transform fields parsed from a text file into our ApplicationActivity model.

Argument.name: activity
Argument.Description: The field named action, which is the raw parsed. action field.

Argument.name: mappedAction
Argument.Description: A normalized ApplicationActivity.Action object.

Rule.name: After Provisioning Rule Template
Rule.Description:
An IdentityIQ server-side rule that is executed after the connector's provisioning method is called. This gives the customer the ability to customize or react to anything in the ProvisioningPlan AFTER it has been sent out to the specific applications.
This rule will be called for any application found in a plan that also has a configured 'afterProvisioningRule' configured.

Argument.name: plan
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningPlan object on its way to the Connector.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application object that references this before/after script.

Argument.name: result
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningResult object returned by the connectors provision method. This can be null and in many cases the connector will not return a result and instead will annotate the plan's ProvisioningResult either at the plan or account level.

Rule.name: Allowed Values Template
Rule.Description:
Allowed Values Rules are used by provisioning policies to determine the possible values of the policy fields.
Note that an Attributes map of arguments from the current WorkflowContext is passed into the Allowed Values Rule. However, the contents of this map are dependent on the use case of the rule. In the default case, the allowed value list is considered static. The rule is evaluated when the form is constructed, and the form will retain that value for the life of the work item presenting the form. In this case, all of the workflow variables are passed to the rule in the Attributes map. In the "dynamic" case, the rule will be evaluated whenever the user interacts with the rule component, thereby allowing it to be sensitive to other fields that have been set in the form. In the "dynamic" case, only the variables that were sent into the work item are passed to the rule in the Attributes map.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The Identity object being provisioned.

Argument.name: form
Argument.Description: The Form object for the provisioning plan.

Argument.name: field
Argument.Description: The Field object being analyzed.

Argument.name: value
Argument.Description: An Object (possibly a Collection) of the allowed values for the given field.

Rule.name: Approval Assignment Template
Rule.Description:
This example rule switches all of the owners to spadmin. The idea of this rule is to allow some customization of the approvals so the ownership can be calculated for cases where you might use and extended attribute or some other means outside our default mechanisms to derive the owner of the Approval.
This rule is typically configured on the Approval Step in the LCM Provisioning Workflow or can be set on any steps based on the "Provisioning Approval" step library.
Since 6.2

Argument.name: log
Argument.Description: The log object associated with the SailPointContext.

Argument.name: context
Argument.Description: A sailpoint.api.SailPointContext object that can be used to query the database if necessary.

Argument.name: approvals
Argument.Description: List of approvals generated by the approvalScheme, maybe null if there were no approvals enabled.

Argument.name: approvalSet
Argument.Description: Representation of the cart, also found on the approvals generated by the default schemes.

Argument.name: newApprovals
Argument.Description: Return a lIst of Workflow.Approval objects that should be included during the approval process.

Rule.name: Before Provisioning Rule Template
Rule.Description:
An IdentityIQ server-side rule that is executed before the connector's provisioning method is called. This gives the customer the ability to customize or react to anything in the ProvisioningPlan BEFORE it is sent to the underlying connectors used in provisioning.
This rule will be called for any application found in a plan that also has a configured 'beforeProvisioningRule' configured.
The plan can be updated directly in the rule by reference and does not need to return the plan.

Argument.name: plan
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningPlan object on its way to the Connector.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application object that references this before/after script.

Rule.name: Build Map Template
Rule.Description: This rule is used by the delimited file connector to build a map representation of the delimited data.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application whose data file is being processed.

Argument.name: schema
Argument.Description: The Schema currently in use.

Argument.name: state
Argument.Description: A Map containing state information.

Argument.name: record
Argument.Description: A List of data tokens parsed from the current line of the data file.

Argument.name: cols
Argument.Description: A List of the columns to use.

Argument.name: map
Argument.Description: A Map of the resource object assembled from the data.

Rule.name: Certification Entity Completion Template
Rule.Description: A CertificationEntity completion rule is run when a CertificationEntity is refreshed and has been determined to be otherwise complete (ie - all items on the entity are complete). This rule determines whether the entity is still missing any information. For example, the entity may require a 'classification' value to be present in a custom field to be complete. If errors are found, the error messages (either plain-text messages or keys that map to messages in the custom message catalog) are added to a List and returned to the caller.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.Certification being refreshed.

Argument.name: entity
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.CertificationEntity being refreshed.

Argument.name: state
Argument.Description: A Map containing state information.

Argument.name: messages
Argument.Description: A List of Message objects if errors were found; null otherwise.

Rule.name: Certification Entity Customization Template
Rule.Description: A CertificationEntity customization rule is run when a certification is generated to allow the CertificationEntity to be customized. For example, default values can be calculated for the custom fields.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.Certification to which the item is being added.

Argument.name: certifiableEntity
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.AbstractCertifiableEntity from which the certifiable was retrieved.

Argument.name: certContext
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.api.CertificationContext that is being used to build the certification.

Argument.name: entity
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.CertificationEntity to be customized.

Rule.name: Certification Entity Refresh Template
Rule.Description: A CertificationEntity refresh rule is run when a CertificationEntity is refreshed. For example, this can copy a custom field from the CertificationEntity down onto all sub-items.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.Certification being refreshed.

Argument.name: entity
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.CertificationEntity being refreshed.

Rule.name: Certification Exclusion Template
Rule.Description: This rule is an example Certification Exclusion rule that removes all of the certifiable items from a certification if the identity being certified is marked as inactive.

Argument.name: entity
Argument.Description: The AbstractCertifiableEntity that is part of the certification. Currently, this is either an Identity, ManagedAttribute, or Bundle.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The certification that this identity is part of.

Argument.name: certContext
Argument.Description: The CertificationContext that is being used to generate the certification.

Argument.name: items
Argument.Description: List of Certifiable items that are currently part of the certification for this identity. Any items that should be excluded from the certification should be deleted from this list and added to the itemsToExclude list.

Argument.name: itemsToExclude
Argument.Description: A List of Certifiable items that should not be included in the certification. This list will be empty when the rule is executed and any items that should not be part of the certification should be moved from the items list to the itemsToExclude list.

Argument.name: state
Argument.Description: A Map containing state information.

Argument.name: explanation
Argument.Description: An optional explanation describing why the items were excluded.

Rule.name: Certification Item Completion Template
Rule.Description: A CertificationItem completion rule is run when a CertificationItem is completed.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.Certification that owns the item.

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.CertificationItem being completed.

Argument.name: entity
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.CertificationItem being completed. Exists as a synonym for 'item'.

Argument.name: state
Argument.Description: A Map containing state information.

Argument.name: result
Argument.Description: Either a List of Strings for simple no-arg Messages, or a List of Lists for variable-arg Messages. In the latter case, the first element of the member List is the message/key, and the rest of the elements are the variable args.

Rule.name: Certification Item Customization Template
Rule.Description: A CertificationItem customization rule is run when a CertificationItem is created.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.Certification that will own the item.

Argument.name: certifiable
Argument.Description: The Certifiable item.

Argument.name: certifiableEntity
Argument.Description: The entity that will own the item.

Argument.name: certContext
Argument.Description: The CertificationBuilder requesting the customization.

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem.

Argument.name: state
Argument.Description: A Map containing state information.

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The customized CertificationItem.

Rule.name: Certification Pre-delegation Template
Rule.Description: A pre-delegation rule that is run on every CertificationEntity when the certification is generated in order to cause some entities to be pre-delegated. As an example, a manager certification could pre-delegate the certification responsibility to each employee that reports to the manager. This would allow each subordinate to first determine what they need access to, then allow the manager to review their decision.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.Certification being created.

Argument.name: entity
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.CertificationEntity to possibly pre-delegate.

Argument.name: certContext
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.api.CertificationContext generating this certification.

Argument.name: state
Argument.Description: A Map containing state information.

Argument.name: recipientName
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that should certify this entity. Either this or 'recipient' should be non-null if pre-delegation should be performed.

Argument.name: recipient
Argument.Description: The Identity that should certify this entity. Either this or 'recipientName' should be non-null if pre-delegation should be performed.

Argument.name: description
Argument.Description: Optional description to set on the delegation WorkItem. If null, a default description of 'Certify [entity name]' is used.

Argument.name: comments
Argument.Description: Optional comments to set on the delegation WorkItems.

Argument.name: reassign
Argument.Description: Optional boolean to specify to reassign rather than delegate.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: Optional String to specify the name for the reassignment certification if creating a new certification for reassignment. This is ignored for delegations.

Rule.name: Certification Sign Off Approver Template
Rule.Description: This rule is run when the certification is signed off to determine who (if anyone) needs to approve the certification decisions. If this returns a non-null identity, the certification is forwarded to the returned identity.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.Certification that was signed.

Argument.name: certifier
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.Identity that signed the certification.

Argument.name: identityName
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that should approve the certification. Either this or 'identity' should be non-null if certification sign off approval is desired.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The Identity that should approve the certification. Either this or 'identityName' should be non-null if certification sign off approval is desired.

Rule.name: Certification Phase Change Rule Template
Rule.Description: This rule is run when the certification either enters or leaves a phase.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.Certification being certified.

Argument.name: certificationItem
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.CertificationItem that is being certified.

Argument.name: previousPhase
Argument.Description: Certification.Phase (may be null) that is the previous phase.

Argument.name: nextPhase
Argument.Description: Certification.Phase (may be null) that is the next phase.

Rule.name: Certification Automatic Closing Rule Template
Rule.Description: This rule is run when the certification is automatically closed.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.Certification being certified.

Rule.name: Certifier Template
Rule.Description: A rule used to assign certifiers to populations generated from a group factory.

Argument.name: factory
Argument.Description: The GroupFactory that generated the populations.

Argument.name: group
Argument.Description: One GroupDefinition from the factory.

Argument.name: state
Argument.Description: A Map containing state information.

Argument.name: certifiers
Argument.Description: A String, List<String>, Identity, or a List<Identity>. When returning strings, the string must be the name or id of an Identity. When returning a single string, the string may be formatted as a CSV of Identity names or ids.

Rule.name: Group Aggregation Refresh Template
Rule.Description: This rule is used to set the owner or modify the account group before it is persisted to the database.

Argument.name: environment
Argument.Description: Arguments passed to the aggregation task.

Argument.name: obj
Argument.Description: A sailpoint.object.ResourceObject generated from the application and the ProvisioningPlan's ObjectRequest.

Argument.name: accountGroup
Argument.Description: The account group being refreshed.

Argument.name: groupApplication
Argument.Description: Application being aggregated.

Argument.name: accountGroup
Argument.Description: The refreshed account group object.

Rule.name: Group Owner Template
Rule.Description: A rule used to assign owners to groups generated from a group factory.

Argument.name: factory
Argument.Description: The GroupFactory that generated the populations.

Argument.name: group
Argument.Description: One GroupDefinition from the factory.

Argument.name: owner
Argument.Description: The group owner. The name or id of an Identity or the Identity object itself.

Rule.name: Composite Account Template
Rule.Description: The Logical Account Rule is used to generate accounts on logical applications. Given an identity, the rule will determine if the identity should have an account on the logical application, and if so, creates and returns an account object for the identity.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The Identity currently being processed.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The logical application.

Argument.name: compositeLink
Argument.Description: A single logical Link or a Collection of logical Links.

Rule.name: Composite Remediation Template
Rule.Description: This rule is called when provisioning needs to be performed against logical accounts. It gets the plan built up by the plan compiler and the rule needs to return a list of Plans to fan out the request across all tiers.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application associated with the connector.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The Identity object that is going to be remediated.

Argument.name: plan
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningPlan created against the logical application.

Argument.name: provisioningPlan
Argument.Description: A converted provisioning plan that targets the applications that make up the logical application.

Rule.name: Composite Tier Correlation Template
Rule.Description: This rule is called when provisioning needs to be performed against tiers.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The Identity object that is being correlated.

Argument.name: tierApplication
Argument.Description: The application owning the tier.

Argument.name: primaryLink
Argument.Description: The Identity's primary link that is being correlated.

Argument.name: links
Argument.Description: A List of Links found between the primaryLink and the tier.

Rule.name: Correlation Template
Rule.Description:
Identity Correlation Rules are used to find identities to which new accounts can be attached.
A correlation rule must return a Map with one of the specified Return arguments.

Argument.name: environment
Argument.Description: Arguments passed to the aggregation task.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: Application being aggregated.

Argument.name: account
Argument.Description: A sailpoint.object.ResourceObject returned from the collector.

Argument.name: link
Argument.Description: Existing link to this account.

Argument.name: identityName
Argument.Description: The name of an Identity object.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: A fully resolved Identity object if the rule wants to do its own queries to locate the identity.

Argument.name: identityAttributeName
Argument.Description: The name of the extended attribute that can be used to locate an existing identity.

Argument.name: identityAttributeValue
Argument.Description: The value of the named extended attribute that can be used to locate an existing identity. This attribute is used together with the identityAttributeName argument.

Rule.name: Email Recipient Template
Rule.Description: This rule is used to select an identity or a list of identities who will receive email.

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.Notifiable Interface for objects that can be reminded, escalated, and expired.

Argument.name: identity name or names
Argument.Description: You can return an identity name or a list of identity names.

Rule.name: Escalation Template
Rule.Description:
Escalation rules are used by the Escalator to figure out where to route notifiable items (work items or certification items) that have expired.
Escalation rules return a string which specifies the name of the identity that should receive the escalated item.

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.Notifiable to escalate.

Argument.name: newOwner
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity object that should be the new owner of the notifiable.

Rule.name: Fallback Work Item Forward Template
Rule.Description: A rule used to pick a fallback owner for a work item in case current owner will cause self-certification.

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The WorkItem being opened. Note that the not all of the WorkItem arguments may be set.

Argument.name: owner
Argument.Description: The Identity that currently owns the work item.

Argument.name: creator
Argument.Description: The name of identity that created the certification belonging to the work item.

Argument.name: certifiers
Argument.Description: A list of certifier names for the certification belonging to the work item.

Argument.name: name
Argument.Description: The name of the certification belonging to the work item. It may be null if certification is not created yet.

Argument.name: type
Argument.Description: The type of the certification belonging to the work item.

Argument.name: newOwner
Argument.Description: An Identity that should own the work item. Alternatively, this can be a String that is the name or id of the Identity.

Rule.name: Field Value Template
Rule.Description: This rule can be used to generate a field value (eg - an account name) using data from the given Identity. If this rule is run in the context of a workflow step then the arguments passed into the step will also be available. Also, any field values that have been processed so far from the policy related to the Application/Role will be available.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The Identity object that represents the user needing the field value.

Argument.name: link
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.Link that is being acted upon. If the link is not applicable, this value will be null.

Argument.name: group
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.ManagedAttribute that is being acted upon. If the managed attribute is not applicable, the value will be null.

Argument.name: project
Argument.Description: The provisioning project being acted upon. If a provisioning project is not applicable, the value will be null.

Argument.name: accountRequest
Argument.Description: The account request. If an account request is not applicable, the value will be null.

Argument.name: objectRequest
Argument.Description: The object request. If an object request is not applicable, the value will be null.

Argument.name: role
Argument.Description: The role with the template we are compiling. If the role is not applicable, the value will be null.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The sailpont.object.Application with the template we are compiling. If the application is not applicable, the value will be null.

Argument.name: template
Argument.Description: The Template that contains this field.

Argument.name: field
Argument.Description: The current field being computed.

Argument.name: current
Argument.Description: The current value corresponding to the identity or account attribute that the field represents. If no current value is set, this value will be null.

Argument.name: operation
Argument.Description: The operation being performed.

Argument.name: value
Argument.Description: The string value created.

Rule.name: File Parsing Template
Rule.Description: This rule is used by the connector to parse each object from non-delimited file formats.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application associated with the Connector calling the rule.

Argument.name: config
Argument.Description: The Attributes map from the Application.

Argument.name: schema
Argument.Description: The Schema from the application.

Argument.name: inputStream
Argument.Description: An InputStream object to the data file.

Argument.name: reader
Argument.Description: A Reader to wrap the InputStream.

Argument.name: state
Argument.Description: A map object that can be used to store data during the iteration process.

Argument.name: map
Argument.Description: A Map of the complete record.

Rule.name: Identity Attribute Template
Rule.Description:
Identity attribute rules are used when the value is not simply a copy of an application account attribute value. A transformation may be necessary on the account attribute, or several account attributes may need to be combined to produce the identity attribute.
This rule can be called in two ways: as a global mapping rule and an application mapping rule. A global mapping rule is called whenever the identity is refreshed. The rule can look at any account attributes. An application mapping rule is called only when the identity contains an account link for that application, this link is passed in the "link" argument which is not passed in global mapping rules.

Argument.name: environment
Argument.Description: Arguments passed to the aggregation or refresh task.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The Identity object that represents the user that is being aggregated.

Argument.name: attributeDefinition
Argument.Description: The AttributeDefinition object for this attribute.

Argument.name: link
Argument.Description: The Link object from the Identity, if this is an application mapping rule. For global mapping rules this will be void.

Argument.name: attributeSource
Argument.Description: The AttributeSource object.

Argument.name: oldValue
Argument.Description: The original value of the application account attribute.

Argument.name: attributeValue
Argument.Description: The value of the attribute that should be populated. The rule should return this value.

Rule.name: Identity Attribute Target Template
Rule.Description: Identity attribute target rules are used to tranform identity attribute values that are being pushed to targets.

Argument.name: value
Argument.Description: The value of the identity attribute. Note that this could be single value or a list of values.

Argument.name: sourceIdentityAttribute
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.ObjectAttribute for this target.

Argument.name: sourceIdentityAttributeName
Argument.Description: The name of the identity attribute for this target.

Argument.name: sourceAttributeRequest
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.ProvisioningPlan.AttributeRequest that is setting the attribute on the identity.

Argument.name: target
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.AttributeTarget that is being processed.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.Identity that is being processed.

Argument.name: project
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.ProvisioningProject that has the changes that are being requested.

Argument.name: attributeValue
Argument.Description: The transformed value that will be pushed to the target.

Rule.name: Identity Creation Template
Rule.Description:
Identity creation rules are used to set attributes on new Identity objects when they are created. New identities may be created during the aggregation of application accounts, or optionally created after pass-through authentication.
One common operation is to change the name property of the identity when the default application name is complex (such as a directory DN).
Another common operation is to assign a set of initial capabilities based on the attributes pulled from the application account.

Argument.name: environment
Argument.Description: Arguments passed to the aggregation task.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: Application being aggregated.

Argument.name: account
Argument.Description: The resource account for the identity being created.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The identity that is being created.

Rule.name: Identity Selector Template
Rule.Description: This rule is used to select an Identity that is related to the given Identity

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The identity.

Argument.name: roleName
Argument.Description: The name of the sailpoint.object.Bundle (role) that is being selected for the Identity. If roles are not applicable to this Identity selection, this value will be void.

Argument.name: success
Argument.Description: True if the selection was successful; false otherwise.

Rule.name: Identity Trigger Template
Rule.Description: This rule can be used for Certification Events that use rule triggers. The previousIdentity and newIdentity hold snapshots of the identity before the update has occurred and the state of the identity after the update, respectively.

Argument.name: previousIdentity
Argument.Description: The identity before the refresh/aggregation (this will be null when an identity is created).

Argument.name: newIdentity
Argument.Description: The identity after the refresh/aggregation (this will be null when an identity is deleted).

Argument.name: result
Argument.Description: A boolean describing the result of the rule.

Rule.name: Integration Template
Rule.Description:
This rule is used by web service integrations to customize the data loaded into a provisioningPlan's integrationData object. The rule is run by the provisioner immediately before the provisioning plan is sent to the integration. The provisioningPlan and its integrationData object are used by Velocity to populate values in the XML templates for the web service calls.
Don't forget to set an Attribute with the name of this Rule so it can be retrieved when needed.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: A sailpoint.object.Identity representing the person being remediated.

Argument.name: plan
Argument.Description: A sailpoint.object.ProvisioningPlan representing remediation.

Argument.name: integration
Argument.Description: The integration config object.

Rule.name: JDBC Build Map Template
Rule.Description: This rule is used by the JDBC connector to build a map representation of the Resultset.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application whose data file is being processed.

Argument.name: schema
Argument.Description: The Schema currently in use.

Argument.name: state
Argument.Description: A Map containing state information.

Argument.name: result
Argument.Description: The ResultSet from database.

Argument.name: connection
Argument.Description: A connection object to connect to database.

Argument.name: map
Argument.Description: A Map of the resource object assembled from the data.

Rule.name: Provisioning Rule Template
Rule.Description: This rule is used by the JDBC connector to do provisioning of the data .

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application whose data file is being processed.

Argument.name: schema
Argument.Description: The Schema currently in use.

Argument.name: connection
Argument.Description: A connection object to connect to database.

Argument.name: plan
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningPlan created against the JDBC application.

Argument.name: result
Argument.Description: A Provisioning Result object is desirable to return the status.IT can be a new object or part of Provisioning Plan

Rule.name: Provisioning Rule Template For Operations
Rule.Description: This rule is used by the JDBC connector to do provisioning of the data .

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application whose data file is being processed.

Argument.name: schema
Argument.Description: The Schema currently in use.

Argument.name: connection
Argument.Description: A connection object to connect to database.

Argument.name: plan
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningPlan created against the JDBC application.

Argument.name: request
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningRequest created against the JDBC application.

Argument.name: result
Argument.Description: A Provisioning Result object is desirable to return the status.IT can be a new object or part of Provisioning Plan

Rule.name: SAP HR Custom Manager Model Rule
Rule.Description: Rule to aggregate the supervisor of the employee using custom code. Use this if there is a need to customize determining the supervisor of employees in SAP HR i.e. if the out-of-box supported OOSP and SS models are not in use in SAP-HR. The arguments "employeeID" and "position" can be used to determine the supervisor of the employee.

Argument.name: destination
Argument.Description: A connected and ready to use com.sap.conn.jco.JCoDestination object that can be used to invoke SAP BAPIs using JCo Interface. Use it to call SAP BAPIs and Function Modules. This destination object is shared with the connector implementation and the connector controls the destination's lifecycle.

Argument.name: schema
Argument.Description: The schema that represents the object.

Argument.name: connector
Argument.Description: The SAP connector object being used to communicate with SAP HR target system. The SAPHR Connector Class has many public utility methods which help in invoking SAP Function Modules and lookup SAP tables.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The SAP application object being used to connect to the SAP system.

Argument.name: state
Argument.Description: A map object that can be used to store data during the iteration process.

Argument.name: employeeID
Argument.Description: Employee ID of the employee.

Argument.name: objectType
Argument.Description: Object type of the schema(i.e. account).

Argument.name: position
Argument.Description: Position ID of the employee.

Argument.name: supervisor
Argument.Description: Supervisor ID of the employee.

Rule.name: Provisioning Rule Template per operations rule for SAP HR
Rule.Description: This rule is used by the SAP HR connector for provisioning of the data .

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application whose data file is being processed.

Argument.name: schema
Argument.Description: The Schema currently in use.

Argument.name: destination
Argument.Description: A connected/ready to use com.sap.conn.jco.JCoDestination object that can be used to call bapi, function modules and call to SAP tables. This is the main object used in making BAPI calls using the JCo interface.This destination object is shared with the connector implementation and the connector controls the destination's lifecycle.

Argument.name: plan
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningPlan created against the SAP application.

Argument.name: request
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningRequest created against the SAP application.

Argument.name: connector
Argument.Description: The SAP connector that is being used to communicate with SAP. This class is here for convenience as there are many utility methods that make calling Function Modules and doing table lookup easier.

Argument.name: result
Argument.Description: A Provisioning Result object is desirable to return the status.IT can be a new object or part of Provisioning Plan

Rule.name: Provisioning Rule Template for generic provisioning operations
Rule.Description: This rule is used by the SAP HR connector for provisioning of the data .

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application whose data file is being processed.

Argument.name: schema
Argument.Description: The Schema currently in use.

Argument.name: destination
Argument.Description: A connected/ready to use com.sap.conn.jco.JCoDestination object that can be used to call bapi, function modules and call to SAP tables. This is the main object used in making BAPI calls using the JCo interface.This destination object is shared with the connector implementation and the connector controls the destination's lifecycle.

Argument.name: plan
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningPlan created against the SAP application.

Argument.name: request
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningRequest created against the SAP application.

Argument.name: connector
Argument.Description: The SAP connector that is being used to communicate with SAP.This class is here for convenience as there are many utility methods that make calling Function Modules and doing table lookup easier.

Argument.name: result
Argument.Description: A Provisioning Result object is desirable to return the status.IT can be a new object or part of Provisioning Plan

Rule.name: Provisioning Rule Template per operations rule for PeopleSoft HRMS
Rule.Description: This rule is used by the PeopleSoft HRMS connector for provisioning of the data .

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application whose data file is being processed.

Argument.name: schema
Argument.Description: The Schema currently in use.

Argument.name: plan
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningPlan created against the PeopleSoft HRMS application.

Argument.name: request
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningRequest created against the PeopleSoft HRMS application.

Argument.name: session
Argument.Description: The session object.

Argument.name: connector
Argument.Description: The PeopleSoft HRMS connector that is being used to communicate with PeopleSoft HRMS system. This class is here for convenience as there are many utility methods that make calling Function Modules and doing table lookup easier.

Argument.name: result
Argument.Description: A Provisioning Result object is desirable to return the status.IT can be a new object or part of Provisioning Plan

Rule.name: Provisioning Rule Template for generic provisioning operations
Rule.Description: This rule is used by the PeopleSoft HRMS connector for provisioning of the data .

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application being processed.

Argument.name: schema
Argument.Description: The Schema currently in use.

Argument.name: plan
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningPlan created against the PeopleSoft HRMS application.

Argument.name: request
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningRequest created against the PeopleSoft HRMS application.

Argument.name: session
Argument.Description: The session object.

Argument.name: connector
Argument.Description: The PeopleSoft HRMS connector that is being used to communicate with PeopleSoft HRMS system.This class is here for convenience as there are many utility methods that make calling Function Modules and doing table lookup easier.

Argument.name: result
Argument.Description: A Provisioning Result object is desirable to return the status.IT can be a new object or part of Provisioning Plan

Rule.name: Link Attribute Template
Rule.Description: This rule is used when promoting account attributes from Links during aggregation.

Argument.name: environment
Argument.Description: The optional arguments passed from the task executor, if the rule is running within a task.

Argument.name: link
Argument.Description: The Link whose attribute is being promoted.

Argument.name: value
Argument.Description: An Object to be used as the attribute value.

Rule.name: Listener Template
Rule.Description: This rule can be used when the ObjectAttribute being listened to has changed.

Argument.name: environment
Argument.Description: Optional arguments passed from the task executor, if the rule is running within a task.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The identity which owns the attribute.

Argument.name: attributeDefinition
Argument.Description: The definition of the ObjectAttribute.

Argument.name: attributeName
Argument.Description: The name of the ObjectAttribute.

Argument.name: oldValue
Argument.Description: The original value of the ObjectAttribute.

Argument.name: newValue
Argument.Description: The new value of the ObjectAttribute.

Rule.name: Managed Attribute Promotion Template
Rule.Description:
A ManagedAttributePromotion rule is called when ManagedAttributes are automatically created during aggregation, refresh, or from the missing entitlement descriptions task.
This can modify the ManagedAttribute that is passed in to set fields such as owner, requestable, or explanations before they are saved.

Argument.name: attribute
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.ManagedAttribute to modify during promotion.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.Application the managed attribute is from.

Argument.name: state
Argument.Description: A Map that contains managed attribute promotion shared state during a task run.

Rule.name: Manager Correlation Template
Rule.Description:
A rule called to help IdentityIQ take a value from the mapped manager field and map it to an existing IdentityIQ identity.
Just like identity correlation, the rule needs to return a map that contains some values that will guide the correlator on how to try to find the identity. It can also do the lookup manually and just returned the identity.

Argument.name: environment
Argument.Description: Arguments passed to the aggregation task.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application the aggregated account is from.

Argument.name: instance
Argument.Description: Optional instance identifier within the application.

Argument.name: connector
Argument.Description: A connector to the attribute source.

Argument.name: link
Argument.Description: Account link of the referencing identity.

Argument.name: managerAttributeValue
Argument.Description: Attribute value that is stored in the manager attribute.

Argument.name: identityName
Argument.Description: The name of an Identity object.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: A fully resolved Identity object if the rule wants to do its own queries to locate the identity.

Argument.name: identityAttributeName
Argument.Description: The name of the extended attribute that can be used to locate an existing identity.

Argument.name: identityAttributeValue
Argument.Description: The value of the named extended attribute that can be used to locate an existing identity. This attribute is used together with the identityAttributeName argument.

Rule.name: Merge Map Template
Rule.Description: This rule merges two maps together. This is used when there are multiple lines that represent the same object, and certain attributes have to merged.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application associated with the Connector calling the rule.

Argument.name: schema
Argument.Description: The Schema from the application.

Argument.name: current
Argument.Description: The current Map object that needs merging.

Argument.name: newObject
Argument.Description: The new Map object that needs merging.

Argument.name: mergeAttrs
Argument.Description: A List of the attributes to merge.

Argument.name: map
Argument.Description: A Map of the current and new maps, merged according to the attributes list.

Rule.name: Owner Template
Rule.Description: Owner Rules are used by provisioning policies to determine the owner of the provisioning policy or its policy fields.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The Identity object being provisioned.

Argument.name: role
Argument.Description: The Role object involved in the provisioning processed.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The Application object being provisioned.

Argument.name: template
Argument.Description: The Template object that defines the provisioning plan.

Argument.name: field
Argument.Description: The Field object being processed.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: Either the Identity of the owner, or the type of template used to define the provisioning policy, from which the owner can be determined.

Rule.name: Policy Template
Rule.Description: This rule is used to determine if a Policy has been violated.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The Identity being inspected.

Argument.name: policy
Argument.Description: The Policy being evaluated.

Argument.name: constraint
Argument.Description: The Constraint being evaluated.

Argument.name: violation
Argument.Description: The PolicyViolation object.

Rule.name: Policy Owner Template
Rule.Description: This rule is used to determine the owner of a Policy violation.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The identity with the policy violation.

Argument.name: policy
Argument.Description: The policy being evaluated.

Argument.name: constraint
Argument.Description: The constraint associated with the violation. Provided if available, set to null if there is no constraint.

Argument.name: identity

Rule.name: Policy Notification Template
Rule.Description: Policy notification rules return a Map, which must contain a key, named identityName, that holds the name of the identity that should receive the policy violation notification.

Argument.name: violation
Argument.Description: A sailpoint.object.PolicyViolation object.

Argument.name: policy
Argument.Description: A sailpoint.object.Policy object.

Argument.name: identityName
Argument.Description: The name of the identity that should be notified.

Rule.name: PostIterate Template
Rule.Description:
This rule is called after the connector processes the data in a file.
Stats is a Map passed in by the connector with the information it has gathered. Custom keys can be added here if necessary for validation.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: Application being iterated.

Argument.name: schema
Argument.Description: Schema requested during iteration.

Argument.name: stats
Argument.Description: A map of the stats for the current file that was just iterated. Contains keys: fileName : (String) filename of the file about to be processed absolutePath : (String) absolute filename length : (Long) length in bytes lastModified : (Long) last time the file was updated Java GMT columnNames : (List) column names that were used during the iteration objectsIterated : (Long) total number of objects iterated during this run

Rule.name: PreIterate Template
Rule.Description: This rule is called before the connector processes the data in a file.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: Application being iterated.

Argument.name: schema
Argument.Description: Schema representing the data being iterated.

Argument.name: stats
Argument.Description: A map passed by the connector of the stats for the file about to be iterated. Contains keys: fileName : (String) filename of the file about to be processed absolutePath : (String) absolute filename length : (Long) length in bytes lastModified : (Long) last time the file was updated Java GMT

Rule.name: Identity Refresh Template
Rule.Description: Identity refresh rules are called during aggregation and identity refresh tasks after all of the other operations have completed. It provides a final hook for modifying the identity before it is persisted and we move on to the next identity.

Argument.name: environment
Argument.Description: The task arguments passed to the aggregation or refresh task.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The identity that is being updated.

Rule.name: Request Object Selector Template
Rule.Description: Request Object Selector Rules are used by the Life Cycle Manager to determine the Objects that can be requested by a given user on a given population. For bulk request this rule is run twice. The first time the result determines which applications are shown to the requestor. The second time the result determines whether or not the specified requestee has access to the object. On the first execution the requestee is always null, so the rule needs to expect and handle that case in order to be usable for bulk requests.

Argument.name: requestor
Argument.Description: Identity that is making the Life Cycle Manager request.

Argument.name: requestee
Argument.Description: Identity on whose behalf the Life Cycle Manager request is being made. In the case of bulk requests, this argument will be set to null when determining the roles that are visible to the requestor. It will be provided once a selection has been made in order to determine whether or not the given requestee should have access to the selected role.

Argument.name: filter
Argument.Description: A Filter object that will be used to search for accessible request objects.

Rule.name: Resource Object Customization Template
Rule.Description:
This rule is configured on the application and is called after the connector has build a ResourceObject from the native application data.
Initially designed for non-rule based connectors to add SPPrivileged flag to an object, but could be used to do any transformations.

Argument.name: object
Argument.Description: The ResourceObject built by the connector.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: Application that references the connector.

Argument.name: connector
Argument.Description: The connector object.

Argument.name: state
Argument.Description: A Map containing state information.

Argument.name: resourceObject
Argument.Description: The updated resource object.

Rule.name: Risk Score Template
Rule.Description: This rule lets you run customized score algorithms that calculate a risk score based on the values of identity attributes.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The Identity whose risk score is being computed.

Argument.name: riskScore
Argument.Description: Either an Integer or String whose value is the computed risk score.

Rule.name: SAP BuildMap Template
Rule.Description:
This rule can be used to customize the SAP object that the connectors build by default.
The rule gets a Map named 'object' that holds all of the attributes built up using the default SAP implementation. The object can be modified/added to here to help support customer customizations and transformations that require the SAP system.
This rule is different from a Customization rule in that it deals with a Map instead of a ResourceObject. The rule also receives a 'destination' object so it can make SAP calls to build up extra data. It's very much like a BuildMap rule from the DelimitedFileConnector, except that it receives a prebuilt Map object.

Argument.name: destination
Argument.Description: A connected/ready to use com.sap.conn.jco.JCoDestination object that can be used to call bapi, function modules and call to SAP tables. This is the main object used in making BAPI calls using the JCo interface. This destination object is shared with the connector implementation and the connector controls the destination's lifecycle.

Argument.name: schema
Argument.Description: The schema that represents the object we are building.

Argument.name: connector
Argument.Description: The SAP connector that is being used to communicate with SAP. This class is here for convenience as there are many utility methods that make calling Function Modules and doing table lookup easier

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The SAP application object being used to connect to the SAP system.

Argument.name: state
Argument.Description: A map object that can be used to store data during the iteration process.

Argument.name: object
Argument.Description: A map object that holds the attributes that have been built up by the default connector implementation. Any attributes built by this rule should be added to this object. This object is handed by reference, so it can be used directly.

Rule.name: Scope Correlation Template
Rule.Description: Given an identity and the defined scope correlation attribute and value, determine the correct assigned scope for the Identity. This can return a single Scope (if we can correlate to a distinct scope), a List of Scopes (if we can't determine a distinct scope), or null (if there is not an assigned scope for the given identity).

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The identity for which to correlate the assigned scope.

Argument.name: scopeCorrelationAttribute
Argument.Description: The name of the scope correlation attribute on the identity.

Argument.name: scopeCorrelationAttributeValue
Argument.Description: The value of the scope correlation attribute on the given identity.

Argument.name: scopes
Argument.Description: Either a Scope or a List that contains multiple scopes that could correlate to the given identity.

Rule.name: SAML Correlation Template
Rule.Description: A rule used to map SAML name Id and attributes to an Identity.

Argument.name: assertionAttributes
Argument.Description: A map where the key is a string and value is a string. The map will always contain a key NameId with the value being the name Id sent by the Identity Provider. All other SAML assertion attributes will be included in the map.

Argument.name: identity Or Link
Argument.Description: The Identity or Link that has been authenticated via SAML SSO. Returning the Link is the preferred way as it provides the exact account back to the server side which can be helpful when collecting authentication for electronic signatures.

Rule.name: Scope Selection Template
Rule.Description: This rule is run if scope correlation for an identity's assigned scope (either from a scope correlation attribute or rule) returns a list of scopes because the correlation is ambiguous. This can happen since scopes are not guaranteed to have unique names. This rule is responsible for selecting the correct scope out of the candidateScopes list for the given identity. If the correct scope cannot be determined, this rule should return null.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The identity for which to correlate the assigned scope.

Argument.name: scopeCorrelationAttribute
Argument.Description: The name of the scope correlation attribute on the identity.

Argument.name: scopeCorrelationAttributeValue
Argument.Description: The value of the scope correlation attribute on the given identity.

Argument.name: candidateScopes
Argument.Description: The List of scopes that were correlated to the given Identity. A single Scope from this list should be selected and returned if it is possible to determine the correct scope.

Argument.name: scope
Argument.Description: A single scope selected from the candidateScopes List, or null if it is impossible to determine the correct scope for the given identity.

Rule.name: SSO Authentication Template
Rule.Description: A rule used to perform SSO authentication.

Argument.name: httpRequest
Argument.Description: A javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest object containing the SSO data.

Argument.name: identity Or Link
Argument.Description: The Identity or Link that has been authenticated via SSO. Starting in 6.1 this rule can return either the Identity or the specific Link that was used to authenticate the user. Returning the Link is the preferred way as it provides the exact account back to the server side which can be helpful when collecting authentication for electronic signatures.

Rule.name: SSO Validation Template
Rule.Description: A rule used to perform SSO validation. Returning a non-null string invalidates the session. The string is used as the error message.

Argument.name: httpRequest
Argument.Description: A javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest object containing the SSO data.

Argument.name: resultMessage
Argument.Description: The message that describes the reason why the validation failed.

Rule.name: Target Correlation Template
Rule.Description: This rule is called when a Target is correlated.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The Application which owns the Target.

Argument.name: nativeId
Argument.Description: The native id associated with an AccessMapping.

Argument.name: target
Argument.Description: The Target being correlated.

Argument.name: targetSource
Argument.Description: The source of the configuration for the collector.

Argument.name: isGroup
Argument.Description: Indicates whether or not this is a GroupMapping.

Argument.name: result
Argument.Description: A Map containing either a ManagedAttribute object ('group') or the name ('groupAttributeName') and value ('groupAttributeValue') of a ManagedAttribute. Link may also be returned since targets may also be correlated to a link object.

Rule.name: Target Creation Template
Rule.Description: This rule is called when a Target is created.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The Application which owns the Target.

Argument.name: target
Argument.Description: The Target being created.

Argument.name: targetSource
Argument.Description: The source of the configuration for the collector.

Argument.name: aggregationSource
Argument.Description: The source of the configuration aggregating the Targets.

Argument.name: target
Argument.Description: The Target being created.

Rule.name: Target Refresh Template
Rule.Description: This rule is called when a Target is refreshed.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The Application which owns the Target.

Argument.name: target
Argument.Description: The Target being created.

Argument.name: targetSource
Argument.Description: The source of the configuration for the collector.

Argument.name: aggregationSource
Argument.Description: The source of the configuration aggregating the Targets.

Argument.name: target
Argument.Description: The Target being created.

Rule.name: Target Transformation Template
Rule.Description: This rule is used by the target aggregation process to allow customizing targets returned from downstream sources.

Argument.name: collector
Argument.Description: The Collector of the Targets.

Argument.name: target
Argument.Description: The Target being transformed.

Argument.name: targetSource
Argument.Description: The source of the configuration for the collector.

Argument.name: target
Argument.Description: The Target being transformed.

Rule.name: Task Event Template
Rule.Description: A rule used to inject logic at a particular stage in the Task execution process.

Argument.name: taskResult
Argument.Description: The current task result object.

Argument.name: event
Argument.Description: The TaskEvent object

Argument.name: taskResult
Argument.Description: The resulting task result object, or null if no update is required.

Rule.name: Transformation Template
Rule.Description: This rule is used by the delimited file connector and will transform a Map into a ResourceObject.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application being processed.

Argument.name: schema
Argument.Description: The schema being iterated.

Argument.name: object
Argument.Description: A Map representing the data to be transformed.

Argument.name: resourceObject
Argument.Description: The resulting ResourceObject.

Rule.name: Validation Template
Rule.Description: This rule is used to validate the Field values on a provisioning plan.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The Identity object being provisioned.

Argument.name: app
Argument.Description: The Application object being processed.

Argument.name: form
Argument.Description: The Form object being processed.

Argument.name: field
Argument.Description: The Field object being validated.

Argument.name: value
Argument.Description: The Object representing the field value.

Argument.name: value
Argument.Description: An Object (possibly a Collection) of messages resulting from the validation rule.

Rule.name: Violation Template
Rule.Description: This rule is used to format a PolicyViolation object.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The Identity in violation.

Argument.name: policy
Argument.Description: The Policy being violated.

Argument.name: constraint
Argument.Description: The Constraint being violated.

Argument.name: violation
Argument.Description: The PolicyViolation object.

Argument.name: state
Argument.Description: A Map containing state information.

Argument.name: violation
Argument.Description: The formatted PolicyViolation object.

Rule.name: Workflow Template
Rule.Description:
A rule used by a Workflow to determine a step action or variable value.
Note that an Attributes map of all variables from the current WorkflowContext, merged with the arguments from the Step, is also passed into the workflow rule.

Argument.name: wfcontext
Argument.Description: The current WorkflowContext.

Argument.name: handler
Argument.Description: The workflow handler associated with the current WorkflowContext.

Argument.name: workflow
Argument.Description: The current Workflow definition.

Argument.name: step
Argument.Description: The current Step.

Argument.name: approval
Argument.Description: The current Approval.

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The WorkItem being processed.

Argument.name: Object
Argument.Description: The result of the workflow rule; dependent on the rule itself.

Rule.name: Work Item Forward Template
Rule.Description: A rule used to examine a WorkItem and determine whether or not it needs to be forwarded to a new owner for further analysis or action. The default forwarding rule in the system configuratin will be called every time a WorkItem is opened, and whenever it is forwarded in the user interface.

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The WorkItem being opened or forwarded.

Argument.name: owner
Argument.Description: The Identity that currently owns the work item.

Argument.name: newOwner
Argument.Description: An Identity that should own the work item. Alternatively, this can be a String that is the name or id of the Identity.

Rule.name: Task Completion Email Rule
Rule.Description: Example rule to send email

Argument.name: context
Argument.Description: A sailpoint.api.SailPointContext object

Argument.name: log
Argument.Description: The log object associated with the SailPointContext.

Argument.name: result
Argument.Description: result of task.

Rule.name: PeopleSoft Build Map Template
Rule.Description: This rule can be used to customize the PeopleSoft resource object that the connectors build by default. The rule gets a resource object map from the buildMap that holds all of the attributes on PeopleSoft HRMS aggregation. The buildMap rule will be modified/added to here to help support customer customizations and transformations that require the PeopleSoft HRMS system.

Argument.name: context
Argument.Description: A sailpoint.api.SailPointContext object that can be used to query the database to aid in provisioning.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application object being used to connect to the PeopleSoft system.

Argument.name: schema
Argument.Description: The schema that represents the object we are building for aggregation.

Argument.name: connection
Argument.Description: Connection to the application database.

Argument.name: state
Argument.Description: A map object that can be used to store data during the iteration process.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: An identity in context of aggregation.

Argument.name: connector
Argument.Description: The connector that is being used to communicate with PeoplesoftHRMS connector functions/methods.

Argument.name: map
Argument.Description: The result of the return map dependent on the rule itself.

Rule.name: After Operation Rule Template for Web Services
Rule.Description: This rule is used by the Web Services connector to update parsed resource object. Create List of Objects which will later converted to Resource object

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application whose data file is being processed.

Argument.name: requestEndPoint
Argument.Description: The current request information contain header, body ,response object

Argument.name: processedResponseObject
Argument.Description: Response Object processed by the Web services connector

Argument.name: rawResponseObject
Argument.Description: Response Object returned from the end system

Argument.name: restClient
Argument.Description: REST Client Object

Argument.name: Update Account/Group List
Argument.Description: Update information Map contains parsed list of accounts

Rule.name: Before Operation Rule Template for Web Services Connector
Rule.Description: This rule is used by the Web Services connector before performing any operation like testconnection, aggregation etc .

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The application whose data file is being processed.

Argument.name: requestEndPoint
Argument.Description: The current request information contain header, body, context url, method type, response attribute map, successful response code

Argument.name: oldResponseMap
Argument.Description: earlier response object

Argument.name: restClient
Argument.Description: REST Client Object

Argument.name: EndPoint
Argument.Description: Updated EndPoint Object

Rule.name: Alert Creation Template
Rule.Description: This rule is called when an Alert is created.

Argument.name: application
Argument.Description: The Application the alert was aggregated from.

Argument.name: alert
Argument.Description: The Alert being created.

Argument.name: alert
Argument.Description: The Alert being created.

Rule.name: Alert Correlation Template
Rule.Description: This rule is called when correlating an Alert to a SailPointObject.

Argument.name: source
Argument.Description: The Application the alert was aggregated from.

Argument.name: alert
Argument.Description: The Alert object.

Argument.name: object
Argument.Description: An instance of a SailPointObject to correlate the Alert to.
